Package com.CZ2002.managers

Class TableManager

java.lang.Object
com.CZ2002.managers.Manager<Table>
com.CZ2002.managers.TableManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class TableManager extends Manager<Table>
The Manager class that maintains the state of and handles all logic surrounding all Table instances in the Restaurant.

This class implements all necessary functionality surrounding Table instances and provides the access point to all Table instances in the Restaurant.

In most cases, each Restaurant should only have a single TableManager instance, although this is not enforced. In this way, this TableManager provides the only access point to all Table instances.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • TableManager

      public TableManager(int maxNumOfTables, int numOf2Seater, int numOf4Seater, int numOf6Seater, int numOf8Seater, int numOf10Seater)
      Constructs a new TableManager with the provided distribution of Table instances.

      Initalises all Table instances in the Restaurant and sets their tableNo to be their index position in entities + 1.

      An exception will be thrown if the total number of tables given by the distribution of table sizes exceeds maxNumOfTables.

      Parameters:
      maxNumOfTables - the total number of tables in the Restaurant
      numOf2Seater - the number of tables in the Restaurant that can accommodate a maximum of 2 guests
      numOf4Seater - the number of tables in the Restaurant that can accommodate a maximum of 4 guests
      numOf6Seater - the number of tables in the Restaurant that can accommodate a maximum of 6 guests
      numOf8Seater - the number of tables in the Restaurant that can accommodate a maximum of 8 guests
      numOf10Seater - the number of tables in the Restaurant that can accommodate a maximum of 10 guests

    • getAvailableTable

      public int getAvailableTable(int[] unavailableTableNos, int pax) throws IllegalArgumentException, NullPointerException
      Returns the tableNumber of the first available Table for the given pax

      It is assumed that all guests must be seated at the same Table, that is, that guests may not be split up across multiple Table instances.

      Parameters:
      unavailableTableNos - the array of tableNo that are considered unavailable
      pax - the number of guests to be seated at the table
      Returns:
      the tableNo that identifies the first table that is available
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if pax exceeds the Table with the largest capcity in the Restaurant
      NullPointerException - if there are no available Table instances

    • checkTableSuitability

      public void checkTableSuitability(int tableNo, int pax) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Checks if a specified Table can accommodate the given pax.
      Parameters:
      tableNo - the table number that identifies the Table to be checked
      pax - the number of guests to be seated at the Table
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the table is not suitable

    • getMaxTables

      public int getMaxTables()
      Returns the total number of Table instances stored in entities
      Returns:
      the total number of Table instances in the Restaurant
